datasource: Heine, Bernd. 1982. Boni Dialects. The Non-Bantu Languages of Kenya. Language and Dialect Atlas of Kenya, vol. 10. Berlin: Dietrich Reimer Verlag. [H82]
geodemoTXT: Kilii is a variety of Northern Boni. The material archived here is from a dialect study by Bernd Heine published in 1982, and is based the speech of one person, who spent most of his life in the town of Badada in South-eastern Somalia.

termclusters.label: bok-Verb:morph-NegativeAffix:
termclusters.note: H82s2.26.3 :: These affixes involve both a prefix and a suffix.

termclusters.label: bok-Verb:morph-SubjMarkerSuffix:
termclusters.note: H82s2.26.62 :: The suffix conjugation sub-classes are:I basic,II medial,III causative,IV nasal.

termclusters.label: bok-VerbPrefix-aham-ImperfectHabitualAffirmative
termclusters.note: H82s2.26.42.2  :: There is no aspect distinction with the negative habitual,the perfect mə-sen-ne serving for the imperfect as well.

termclusters.label: bok-VerbSuffixClass-ark-ImperfectSubjunctiveAffirmative
termclusters.note: H82s2.26.5 :: subjunctive suff identical with imperf neg and,with exception of pl 2,3 also with those of perf.

termclusters.label: bok-VerbSuffixS1-ajik-ImperfectAffirmative
termclusters.note: H82s2.26.61 :: ajik- no longer belongs to the preix conj,but has become a suffix conjClass I verb. It is being replaced by udeey- (note also irregular persona suffixes in imperf neg.
